intro: [WRONG START] Elaphoglossum lawyeraa, commonly known as the Lawry's holly fern, is a species of fern belonging to the family Polypodiaceae. It is characterized by its delicate, finely divided fronds that are typically bi- or tri-pinnate, giving it a lacy appearance. The plant is native to tropical regions of Central and South America, where it thrives in humid, shaded environments. Its spores are produced in sori that are arranged in lines along the margins of the fertile fronds. Elaphoglossum lawyerae is often found growing on rock surfaces or in moist, forested areas, showcasing its adaptability to diverse microhabitats.
